Today I joined my colleagues Rep. John Lewis  and Sen. Cory Booker to testify against the nomination of Senator Jeff Sessions. Sen. Sessions has a track record of hindering the progress of the African-American community and we cannot afford for him to get confirmed.

Congratulations to Shaw alum Vance Joseph on becoming the new Head Coach of the Denver Broncos. He was a star athlete because of his passion for the sport and it has rewarded him again.  http://www.nola.com/saints/index.ssf/2017/01/broncos_introduce_vance_joseph.html
John Lewis' record speaks for itself. What he's done and sacrificed has made this country a more perfect union.

As we take time to reflect this Martin Luther King Day remember the tremendous courage and sacrifice required to build and maintain his legacy.   His work is far from over and we must continually commit ourselves toward making his dream come true.

Betsy DeVos has proved time and time again that she is not concerned with the educational advancement of students in Detroit. Instead, her interest lies with defunding public schools and being the architect of failed for-profit charter systems. The President of Michigan's State Board of Education has noted "DeVos' agenda is to break the public education system, not educate kids, and replace it with a for-profit model." If she's thought of in that manner in her own state, do we really need her as Secretary of Education? #KidsNotCash

Mr. Price is so adamant about privatizing Medicare that he is a part of an organization that believes that "government assumption of responsibility for medical care is 'evil' and 'immoral'" We cannot allow the confirmation of Mr. Price, because he will roll back the progress we have made with the Affordable Care Act.
“President Trump’s pick for a senior leadership position in the civil rights division of DOJ is a slap in the face to what the division has represented for over 50 years,”   http://bit.ly/2j639kp
President Trump's first week in office.

“In these uncertain times, increased vigilance when it comes to nuclear materials is especially critical,”  https://richmond.house.gov/press-releases/rep-richmond-passage-nuclear-detection-improvement-act
I cannot and will not stay silent as President Trump continues to prove he is not willing to ensure Americans have all the rights and protections the Supreme Court is meant to uphold.

“Black Media and particularly the Black Press play and extraordinary role in getting our message out to our communities, print media especially plays an important role because the Black Press is highly regarded within our communities and people have a greater trust in the information that they receive via the Black Press”.  It is important that we continue to support Black-owned business, especially media outlets that highlight the work of African-American leaders  https://lasentinel.net/congressman-cedric-richmond-brings-bold-new-leadership-to-congressional-black-caucus.html
As a proud Morehouse graduate and former student-athlete, it is so important that the NFL recognizes their HBCU Pro-Football players http://bit.ly/2kFcEa4
My thoughts and prayers go out to everyone who has been affected by today's severe weather. Please stay safe and we will provide updates as they are given.
Below is the link to my statement on today’s storm.  Updates with resources will be coming soon.   https://richmond.house.gov/press-releases/rep-richmond-severe-storms-new-orleans
There is a temporary shelter opening at Joe Brown Recreation Center in New Orleans East. Please share the information below with friends or family who may have been impacted by today's storms.
More updates including New Orleans Fire Department primary search of damaged homes and Red Cross phone numbers!

A disaster recovery center is now open for residents of Orleans Parish. Please share the information below with those affected by last week's tornadoes. My office will continue to post updates as we receive them!
Below you will find information about how to apply for disaster assistance!
NA

Resource Updates for Orleans Parish:  Orleans Parish citizens who have been affected by the recent tornadoes can now apply for Disaster Unemployment Assistance and the Disaster Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (DSNAP).   For those applying for DSNAP, to help expedite the application process, DCFS is encouraging residents in all affected areas to pre-register for DSNAP benefits online at www.dcfs.la.gov/preregister.  Regular SNAP households SHOULD NOT go to a DSNAP site. Households that receive regular SNAP benefits can apply for replacement benefits through DCFS if they lost food in the tornadoes. They must report their loss by contacting a local DCFS office by Friday, February 24

“While I am not surprised by Justice Thomas’ lack of awareness, I remain frustrated that the lone African-American judge on our nation’s highest court continuously ignores the lived experience of everyday Black Americans and stands in the way of justice.”

Women have constantly been the driving force for change in this country and I’m happy to celebrate #WomensHistoryMonth by honoring a few fearless women who have pushed Louisiana forward!

The lack of transparency from the White House cannot continue. I am proud to stand with  U.S. House Committee on the Judiciary - Democrats to ensure that Americans are receiving the information they need to understand these issues and be able to draw their own conclusions.

We all continue to praise and commemorate the bravery of Ruby Bridges, but do we ever wonder what school integration would look like if she decided not to walk into William Frantz Elementary that day? #InternationalWomensDay #ADayWithoutAWoman

Over twenty years ago, one woman changed the culture of Mardi Gras by addressing the injustice and racism that existed within the traditions of large Mardi Gras Krewes.   #InternationalWomensDay #ADayWithoutAWoman

It is absolutely ridiculous the President assumes cutting Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA), U.S. Coast Guard, and TSA budgets for mass deportation is a good idea.   Making it harder for families to receive natural disaster resources and putting ports and airports at risk will not serve for the good of this country!  http://wapo.st/2myKLB7?tid=ss_tw

"As Republicans in Washington move forward with their destructive health reform legislation, they would be wise to look at Louisiana’s example before dismantling the Medicaid expansion. "  http://www.theadvocate.com/baton_rouge/opinion/article_a5f9c388-04e5-11e7-a069-3f8f310c9efc.html

If the Affordable Care Act has been beneficial to you and your family, please fill out the survey located in the newsletter. We need to show Republicans how the Affordable Care Act is helping Louisiana.   http://bit.ly/ACANewsletter

Many of you have called my office to express your concern about the proposed cut of the National Endowment for the Arts. I strongly believe that Louisiana’s culture would not be what it is today without support for programs that develop our next generation of artists. #LAWithoutArt
As my Republican colleagues attempt to repeal the Affordable Care Act this week, I want to highlight stories from Louisiana’s second district to show that #ACAWorks4LA in hopes they will listen.
Daquin, you are not forgotten and I am fighting to ensure citizens like you do not feel forgotten by the GOP #ACAWorks4LA

Many people tend to underestimate the need for mental health services and constituents like Michelle should not have to spend an absurd amount of money to get their kids the help they deserve.   #ACAWorks4LA #ACA7

The Congressional Art Competition 2017 is officially underway! High school students in Louisiana’s 2nd district are encourage to enter their artwork for a chance to win a round-trip to Washington, D.C. for the Congressional Art Competition Reception and the opportunity for their artwork to be displayed in Cannon Tunnel of the U.S. Capitol.  *Please note if you are in 7th or 8th grade at a continual school, you can enter the competition!    The deadline to drop off your artwork is April 21st, 2017 by 7 pm!  Mor information including rules and regulations for the art competition can be found at http://bit.ly/LA02CAC2017

We all have him to thank for how far we have risen since the day he first joined a picket line and for the heights we will reach in the future.”   My statement on the passing of Lolis Edward Elie: http://bit.ly/2oI46hV

The President’s proposed budget and health care plan clearly show Louisiana is not a priority for him. As your representative, I will remain vocal about how the policies of this administration will be detrimental to the people of Louisiana.  http://bit.ly/2oBzUrL

Transitional sheltering assistance has been extended by FEMA  for Louisiana residents who were affected by August flooding.
For families affected by the devastating August flooding, there are still resources available to help you rebuild. Head over to http://restore.la.gov/ for more information.

Today in 1954, The U.S. Supreme Court handed down the decision in the monumental Brown vs. The Board of Education case.  As we remember this day, we must keep in mind the following:  "In these days, it is doubtful that any child may reasonably be expected to succeed in life if he is denied the opportunity of an education. Such an opportunity, where the state has undertaken to provide it, is a right which must be made available to all on equal terms." - Chief Justice Warren

“The President makes his priorities clear and strips funding from programs that help working families get ahead. Our economy is strongest when investment is focused from the middle out, rather than the top down. Instead, the President’s proposal delivers the moon and stars to the wealthiest Americans while leaving the middle class without a parachute.”  https://richmond.house.gov/press-releases/rep-richmond-statement-president-s-budget-proposal-0
#ActionsSpeakLouderThanWords   http://www.theadvocate.com/baton_rouge/opinion/article_21e6de34-3fe4-11e7-bcfd-8bc839cb620c.html

With Hurricane Season quickly approaching, I will be sharing tips on how you should prepare for what this season may bring. As always, you can head to https://richmond.house.gov/serving-you/disaster-preparedness for more information and resources on disaster preparedness.

We are predicted to have an above-normal hurricane season and I want you to stay informed and be prepared. Sign-up for my newsletter here: https://richmond.congressnewsletter.net/mail/util.cfm?mailaction=profile
‪We honor the brave men and women who fearlessly fought for this country & paid the ultimate sacrifice of their lives. #MemorialDay‬
When preparing for hurricane season, it is imperative that you review your insurance documents and speak with your insurance agent about the specifics of your policy.

Thank you, National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration for sharing this great video about the steps to take when preparing for a disaster. Hurricane season starts today and I want to make sure LA02 is prepared!

#DidYouKnow If you live in a high-risk flood zone, and you've received federal disaster assistance in the form of grants from FEMA or low-interest disaster loans from the U.S. Small Business Administration (SBA) following a Presidential Disaster Declaration, you must maintain flood insurance in order to be considered for any future federal disaster aid. The damage from just one inch of water can cost more than $20,000. For more tips like this, visit https://www.fema.gov/national-flood-insurance-program
I am saddened by the horrific news from GOP baseball practice. My prayers are with my colleague Congressman Steve Scalise , the Capitol police officers, and staff.
Happy Father's Day to all of the fathers out there. I hope you enjoy your special day.   Photo Credit: The Undefeated

I encourage everyone to stay safe & stay updated with Louisiana Governor's Office of Homeland Security and Emergency Preparedness & US National Weather Service New Orleans Louisiana regarding tropical storm #Cindy.

The Governor has officially declared a state of emergency across Louisiana. I encourage everyone to stay off the roads due to the chance of increased flooding today and continue to stay updated with Louisiana Governor's Office of Homeland Security and Emergency Preparedness and US National Weather Service New Orleans Louisiana  http://www.nola.com/politics/index.ssf/2017/06/cindy_louisiana_emergency.html

Looks like GOP Senators didn’t learn anything from their colleagues in the House. The Senate Healthcare Bill is the same callous attempt to turn healthcare for hardworking people into tax cuts for the richest Americans.   https://mobile.nytimes.com/2017/06/22/us/politics/senate-leaders-unveil-bill-to-repeal-the-affordable-care-act.html?referer=http://m.facebook.com

This morning, I got the opportunity to engage with bright, future leaders from the Congressional Black Caucus Foundation. They asked great questions and showed their genuine interest in policy. Very special shout out to the LA-02 CBCF Intern Louis Gremillion Jr..
Join me tomorrow as I talk to multiple health experts about the disastrous bill that could leave 22 million more people uninsured.

Today, I will be asking health experts the questions the Senate GOP did not. I will be joined by AARP Louisiana, National Women's Law Center, Louisiana Department of Health, & National Council for Behavioral Health to talk about their concerns with this healthcare bill. Make sure you follow me on Twitter @RepRichmond

ICYMI: This week, I hosted a Twitter Roundtable where health care experts shared their deep concerns with the #SenateHealthcareBill. Find the recap here: https://twitter.com/i/moments/859084155786809345

Art is a very important aspect of New Orleans culture and I was happy to sit down with our #CongressionalArtCompetition17 Winner Cooper Monzon to talk about his piece titled "NOLA Domino". Congrats again Cooper!
I want to wish everyone a safe and happy July 4th!

It is so important that our young people understand the importance of financial literacy. I was glad I got the chance to speak with Excite All Stars today about how to be financially responsible at an early age.

"Today, as we reflect on how far we’ve come, we must continue to pray for the safety of everyone affected by Harvey." #Katrina12   https://richmond.house.gov/press-releases/rep-richmond-statement-twelfth-anniversary-hurricane-katrina

Be advised, the deadline (Oct.31) is near for the flood aid program for Louisiana businesses!  This program is for small businesses in Louisiana that were impacted by last year’s floods.  The loans will range from $10,000 to $150,000 for all small businesses and nonprofits in the 51 parishes that had damage from the 2016 March & August floods. These loans can be used to pay rent, utilities, mortgage, employee wages and some non-construction repair expenses so don’t miss out!   Apply by October 31st, 2017 to ensure consideration for this program! http://restore.la.gov/small-business-program-detailstimeline/

This week the House is scheduled to vote on the GOP Budget. This bill will be disastrous for our citizens and I cannot stay silent about the adverse effects it will have on the lives of everyday Americans.   Each day until we vote, I will highlight the different aspects of the proposed budget that will negatively affect families in Louisiana.  Today, my focus is on Medicare and Medicaid. Funding for these two programs is vital to the thousands of Louisiana citizens who have gained affordable healthcare under these programs, especially our senior citizens for whom Medicare is their sole source of coverage. This budget demonstrates the GOP’s willingness to attack vulnerable, hard-working Americans to benefit the wealthy.  Have you and your family benefitted from Medicare or Medicaid? Share your story in the comments. The GOP needs to hear from you!

Today, we have lost a New Orleans legend. I am saddened by the passing of Fats Domino, but I know his musical legacy will live on for generations to come.   https://richmond.house.gov/press-releases/rep-richmond-mourns-passing-new-orleanian-antoine-fats-domino-0  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=I6JZW7zMDfY
Don't miss out on your chance to #GetCovered. Open Enrollment starts tomorrow, November 1st. Head over to healthcare.gov for more info.

Open Enrollment starts TODAY! Don’t miss out on your chance at getting covered. You have the next 45 days to ensure you and your family are covered. Head over to healthcare.gov for more information. As always, please do not hesitate to contact my office if you have any questions or concerns .  http://www.theadvocate.com/baton_rouge/news/business/article_340c40ea-bd84-11e7-aeb3-43be9b7a4708.html

Today, House GOP presented a children’s healthcare reauthorization at the expense of Medicare & Public Health Fund.  Healthcare is not a zero-sum game. You don’t have to take healthcare away from some in order to give it to others. Instead of doing what is right, Republicans would rather play politics with a federal program that millions of children rely on.  Read my statement here: https://cbc.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=784

This week, Committee on Ways and Means will mark-up the GOP's tax plan that will cut vital programs and tax credits for low and middle-income families to give tax breaks to the wealthy. We need a real, bipartisan solution to create economic growth for everyone, not just some. Comment below to tell me what concerns you most about the GOP's tax plan

If you're one of the 544,000 Louisianans with student loan debt, the GOP Tax Plan will completely take away the Student Loan Deduction which gives you the option to deduct the interest that has incurred on your loans.   What could you do with the extra money the student loan deduction puts back in your pocket?

Join me today on Twitter (@RepRichmond) as I #AskTheExperts about how the GOP Tax Plan will be detrimental to working families in Louisiana. I will be joined by Louisiana Budget Project and New Orleans Metropolitan Association of REALTORS to answer your questions.
https://richmond.house.gov/press-releases/rep-richmond-votes-against-national-flood-insurance-program-reauthorization

Jeff Sessions for Attorney General because of his clear lack of understanding about the importance of diversity and inclusion within the Justice Department. Yesterday, I got the opportunity to ask him how he is combating diversity in the Justice Department and this was his answer....
Extending warm Thanksgiving wishes to you and your family.  In the midst of all the noise, I hope you are able to enjoy loved ones and take stock of everything you are thankful for.

CHIP expired two months ago, The National Flood Insurance Program will expire on Dec. 8, disaster-wrecked territories and states are still in need of supplemental disaster funding, and we have 11 days to fund the government for the year. Instead of focusing on the critical matters at hand, the GOP would rather attempt to pass a tax bill that hurts hard-working Americans. https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/wonk/wp/2017/11/26/senate-gop-tax-bill-hurts-the-poor-more-than-originally-thought-cbo-finds/?tid=sm_fb&utm_term=.4d556630e177

Congrats to New Orleans‘ very own PJ Morton for scoring two Grammy nominations today for his 4th studio album Gumbo! I know we’ll all be rooting for two big wins. Congratulations again and continue to make the city proud.

Yesterday, I took to the House floor to congratulate New Orleans Mayor-Elect LaToya Cantrell. As New Orleans approaches its 300th year, I am proud to say we have elected our 1st female Mayor. Congratulations again!
NA
Don't forget that this year's open enrollment period under the Affordable Care Act ends on December 15th. Head over to healthcare.gov to learn more.

CHIP expired on September 30, 2017, and Congress has failed to pass a clean reauthorization. Instead of funding this program, the GOP is reconciling their disastrous tax bill.  Too many children across Louisiana and across the country rely on this program for affordable healthcare and they deserve a clean reauthorization.  http://www.nola.com/politics/index.ssf/2017/12/louisiana_child_health_insuran.html

I cannot, in good conscience, vote for a bill that will... 1. Give 32% of the tax breaks to the top 1% in Louisiana 2. Result in 86 million middle-class households seeing a tax increase 3. Cap SALT at $10,000  This bill isn't for hard-working Americans, it was written for the wealthiest Americans to put more money in their pockets.
